marketNews.title: Danantara Releases Patriot Bonds Worth IDR 50 T
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that BPI Danantara plans to issue Patriot Bonds worth 50 trillion rupiah on October 1, 2025. This bond issuance will reportedly consist of 2 series, namely 5-year tenor and 7-year tenor, each valued at 25 trillion rupiah with a coupon rate of 2%, far below the yield of similar tenor government bonds in the range of 6%. Due to the low yields, these bonds are said to be offered through private placement to a number of national business leaders. Danantara's Chief Investment Officer (CIO), Pandu Sjahrir, explained that these bonds are a strategic financing instrument commonly used in various countries, such as Japan and the United States (US), to strengthen national financing independence. The issuance of these bonds is supported by several conglomerates such as Prajogo Pangestu, Franky Widjaja, and Boy Thohir. Through its official page, Danantara stated that the funds raised from these bonds will be invested in the energy transition sector and others. Meanwhile, Bloomberg reported that the funds will be used for waste-to-energy (WTE) projects. The issuance of these bonds occurred just one day after the Coordinating Minister for Food Affairs, Zulkifli Hasan, stated that the Presidential Regulation (Perpres) related to WTE is expected to be issued in the next one or two days. Based on PLN's Electricity Provision Business Plan (RUPTL) for 2025, the construction of electricity generation installations based on environmentally friendly technology from waste processing will be located in 12 cities: Palembang, Tangerang, South Tangerang, DKI Jakarta, Bandung, Bekasi, Semarang, Surakarta, Surabaya, Makassar, Manado, and Denpasar, with a total plant capacity of 453 MW up to 2034.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The plan for this bond issuance provides a positive sentiment to issuers that have exposure to the WTE business and its ecosystem such as TOBA and OASA, where their stock prices strengthened by +17.9% and +24.3% respectively in today's trading, Tuesday (26/8). TOBA itself, in March 2025, completed the acquisition of Sembcorp Environment, a household waste management company in Singapore located in Jurong. Meanwhile, OASA plans to collaborate with a company from China to build a WTE plant at the Cipeucang TPA, Serpong. This project is estimated to be worth 1.69 trillion rupiah and will generate 15.7 MW of electricity.

marketNews.content: 1. US President, Donald Trump, is attempting to remove one of the Fed governors, Lisa Cook, based on allegations that Cook made false statements regarding one or more mortgage loans. This transaction is part of the plan for Poh Group Pte. Ltd. to acquire 70% of NINE shares, following the sale of shares by Agatha Nindya and Merry Kandou in February 2025. 4. Deputy Minister of BUMN, Kartika Wirjoatmodjo, stated that this step is the initial phase of merging these companies into Danantara through a share inbreng scheme. 5. Sarana Mitra Luas (SMIL) announced that it has realized a buyback of approximately 4.4 million (0.02%) shares with an execution price of 458-462 rupiah per share on August 25, 2025. The total purchase value was approximately 2 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: BBRI 7M25: Bank Only Net Profit -9% YoY
tickerNews.content: Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) posted bank only net profit of 3.8 trillion rupiah in July 2025 (+20% YoY, -38% MoM). This result brought the bank only net profit for 7M25 to 28.6 trillion rupiah (-9% YoY), equivalent to 50.3% of the consolidated 2025F consensus estimate (vs. 7M24 bank only: 52.2% realization of 2024 consolidation). The year-on-year increase in net profit in July 2025 was driven by a significant decrease in provision expenses (-55% YoY, -12% MoM), even though Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) was relatively weak at 7.6 trillion rupiah (-28% YoY, -31% MoM). Cumulatively over 7M25, the decrease in net profit was driven by: 1) weak PPOP by -4% YoY due to an increase in opex of +10% YoY; and 2) provision expenses increasing by +4% YoY. As of July 2025, bank only credit growth was recorded at +5% YoY, remaining relatively stable compared to June 2025 growth.

tickerNews.title: PANI Announces Private Placement to Strengthen Subsidiary Capitalization
tickerNews.content: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua (PANI) announced plans to conduct a private placement worth 300 billion rupiah by issuing up to approximately 20.9 million new shares to be taken up by the controller, PT Multi Artha Pratama. The placement price is 14,350 rupiah per share. The placement price is a minimum of 90% of the average closing price of the company's shares over the last 25 trading days. The funds raised are intended to strengthen the capital structure of its subsidiaries, namely PT Cahaya Inti Sentosa, PT Panorama Eka Tunggal, and PT Karunia Utama Selaras. This corporate action is part of the private placement plan approved in the EGM Extraordinary Meeting in June 2024.

tickerNews.title: UNTR Equipment Sales and Mining Contractor Performance for 7M25
tickerNews.content: United Tractors (UNTR) recorded sales of Komatsu heavy equipment amounting to 370 units in July 2025 (-2.4% MoM, +0.5% YoY). Cumulatively over 7M25, Komatsu sales reached 3,098 units (+23.2% YoY), equivalent to 67% of the 2025 target of 4,600 units, with market share stable at 24% (vs. 1H25: 24%, 7M24: 28%). In the mining contractor segment, UNTR recorded coal production volume of 82.7 million tons (-1.4% YoY) during 7M25, with overburden removal at 637.9 million bcm (-8.8% YoY).

tickerNews.title: BSDE Vice President Director Purchases Shares
tickerNews.content: The Vice President Director of Bumi Serpong Damai (BSDE), Michael J. P. Widjaja, purchased approximately 3.3 million BSDE shares at an average price of approximately 911 rupiah per share on August 19, 2025. The total transaction value reached 3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Michael J. P. Widjaja's direct ownership portion increased from 0.04% to 0.06%.

tickerNews.title: Saratoga Investama Sedaya (SRTG) Portfolio Companies May IPO in 2-3 Years
tickerNews.content: Bisnis reported that Saratoga Investama Sedaya shareholder, Sandiaga Salahuddin Uno, opened the possibility of an IPO plan for 3 portfolio companies of SRTG within the next 2-3 years, including the beauty clinic ZAP, the restaurant brand Misoa Story, and the hotel operator Bobobox. Previously, in January 2025, SRTG Investment Director, Devin Wirawan, mentioned that they opened the opportunity for an IPO for MGM Bosco Logistics, which operates in the cold chain logistics business, and the energy company Xurya Energy.
